title: Promising results from DeepSeek R1 for code
author: k__
aiHeadline: In a shocking turn of events, DeepSeek R1 is actually showing some promising results for code, because who doesn't love a good AI-powered coding buddy to help with all the tedious debugging, and it's about time someone made a tool that can understand our sloppy coding habits, am I right?

title: Run DeepSeek R1 Dynamic 1.58-bit
author: noch
aiHeadline: Get ready to 'run' away with excitement as DeepSeek R1 Dynamic 1.58-bit takes the world of AI-powered coding by storm, or at least that's what the marketing team wants you to think, but hey, who needs actual innovation when you can just add 'dynamic' to the name and call it a day?

title: New speculative attacks on Apple CPUs
author: cylo
aiHeadline: Apple CPUs are under attack, and no, it's not just your aunt trying to Facetime you for the 12th time today, but actual speculative attacks that are making everyone in the tech world go 'oh no, what's next, are our iPads going to start sending out spam emails too?'

title: Machine Learning in Production (CMU Course)
author: azhenley
aiHeadline: Carnegie Mellon University is offering a course on Machine Learning in Production, because what every college student really needs is another reason to pull an all-nighter, but hey, at least you'll be learning about the wonders of ML and how to deploy it in the real world, or you know, just how to make a decent cup of coffee to fuel your coding sessions

title: Boom XB-1 First Supersonic Flight [video]
author: rayhaanj
aiHeadline: The Boom XB-1 just made its first supersonic flight, and by 'supersonic' I mean it went really, really fast, like faster than your internet connection when you're trying to stream Netflix, but slower than the pace at which your phone battery drains when you're trying to watch said Netflix, and there's a video to prove it, because what's a historic moment without a little YouTube fame?
